title: Part B

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain why there is a difference in pesticide use between wheat farming and beef production, such as the following:

· Wheat farming uses large amount of pesticides to kill insects and weeds, while beef production does not require the use of pesticides to raise cattle.

The response explains why there is a difference in pesticide use between wheat farming and beef production, such as the following:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one environmental problem associated with the energy-based expense that is highest in the production of poultry, such as any of the following:

· Fossil fuel combustion contributes to increased greenhouse gases and climate change.

· Fossil fuel combustion emissions cause air pollution problems such as acid rain/tropospheric ozone production/increased particulates.

· Production and transmission of electrical lines can cause increased land use/habitat destruction.

· Mining for fossil fuels/uranium can increase environmental costs associated with water and air pollution, and habitat loss.

· Fracking for to extract natural gas can cause groundwater contamination /air pollution (need to name one)/earthquakes.

· Nuclear power plants release thermal pollution from the dumping of heated coolant water from power plants.

· Nuclear power plants can accidentally release radioactive waste into the environment from storage of used nuclear fuel rods.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain how a shift from growing soybeans with traditional tillage to no-till methods will affect the ecological footprint of the farm, such as any of the following:

· No-till reduces farming reduces ecological footprint by reducing soil erosion which better maintains soil quality, so less fertilizer is necessary.

· No-till leaves farming reduces ecological footprint by leaving residue on crops that can increase nutrient cycling and require less fertilizer use.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain why a dairy farmer installing PV MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGqbGaaeOvaaaa@37C2@ solar panels at the farm would or would not be an effective long-term approach for reducing energy costs, such as any of the following:

· It would not be an effective long-term approach. The dairy farmer has a relatively small electricity expense so the investment in solar energy would not be a good long-term solution to reduce costs.

· It would be an effective long-term approach. The dairy farmer has about 30% of their energy-based costs for electricity, so switching to solar could reduce the cost in this portion of their expenses.

· This would not be an effective approach. The dairy farmer could be in an area that does not have sufficient sunlight to provide enough energy to be a good long-term solution to reduce costs and to offset installation and ongoing maintenance costs.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe how one conservation landscaping technique can reduce home electricity consumption during cold winters, such as any of the following:

· Planting windbreaks near the house will reduce wind velocity and prevent heat loss from windows.

· Avoid planting trees where the sun can warm the house in winter to reduce reliance on artificial heating/lighting.

title: Part J

descriptions:
